page.title: 01MAIN FEATURES OF THE AREA
page.content: Our area around the village of{Ewyas {Harold}is in the county of{Hereford, in{England}but the border of{Wales}is very close. Geographicaly the area is very interesting, with the high long narrow ridge of the{Black Mountains}forming a natural border to the west. This high ridge and the hills and valleys immediately around our village were formed by glacial action during the ice age. Our area has three villages the largest is{Ewyas Harold,}and the others are quite small{-Dulas and{Abbey Dore. Two rivers run through the area and eventually join the{River Monnow .}The valley of the{River Dore}between Ewyas Harold and{Abbey Dore}is wide and fertile. It is called the{Golden {Valley.
